alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 9:22PM CST until January 06 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water begins to inundate agricultural land and other low lying areas along the river including access points from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.9 feet and falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling overnight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 600 AM CST.
